intro: Synthyris reniformis var. major, commonly known as the broadleaf synthyris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features broad, heart-shaped leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple, blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Its botanical characteristics make it a notable species in wetland and meadow ecosystems.
